table.name: ro_special_service_accessorial
table.description: Accessorials provided with the rate offerings.

columns.name: ACCESSORIAL_COST_GID
columns.description: The GID for the accessorial cost.

columns.name: RATE_OFFERING_GID
columns.description: The GID for the rate offering.

columns.name: ACCESSORIAL_CODE_GID
columns.description: The GID for the accessorial code.

columns.name: SPECIAL_SERVICE_GID
columns.description: The GID for the special service. You can define a special services on a rate as either a special service that's available/provided with the rate defined or the special service may be provided for a charge which is defined by the related accessorial. When entering a free special service, you only need to enter a special service code GID. When entering a special service that has an accessorial, enter a Special Service code, as well as an Accessorial Code ID and an Accessorial Cost ID.

columns.name: DOMAIN_NAME
columns.description: Database domain where this data is stored.

columns.name: INSERT_USER
columns.description: The user ID of the data insert user.

columns.name: INSERT_DATE
columns.description: Date and time of data insert.

columns.name: UPDATE_USER
columns.description: The user ID of the data update user.

columns.name: UPDATE_DATE
columns.description: Date and time of the most recent data update.
